Package imusim :: Package io :: Module qualisys_tsv

Source Code for Module imusim.io.qualisys_tsv

  1  """ 
  2  Loader for Qualisys optical capture data in TSV format. 
  3  """ 
  4  # Copyright (C) 2009-2011 University of Edinburgh 
  5  # 
  6  # This file is part of IMUSim. 
  7  # 
  8  # IMUSim is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it 
  9  # under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by 
 10  # the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or 
 11  # (at your option) any later version. 
 12  # 
 13  # IMUSim is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, 
 14  # but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of 
 15  # MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the 
 16  # GNU General Public License for more details. 
 17  # 
 18  # You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License 
 19  # along with IMUSim.  If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>. 
 20   
 21  from __future__ import division 
 22  from imusim.capture.marker import MarkerCapture, Marker3DOF, Marker6DOF 
 23  from imusim.maths.quaternions import Quaternion, QuaternionArray 
 24  import numpy as np 
 25   

 26 -def loadQualisysTSVFile(filename): 

 27      """ 
 28      Load 3DOF or 6DOF marker data from a Qualisys Track Manager TSV file. 
 29   
 30      @param filename: Name of TSV file to load. 
 31   
 32      @return: A L{MarkerCapture} instance. 
 33      """ 
 34   
 35      # Open file to read header. 
 36      datafile = open(filename, 'r') 
 37   
 38      # Count of header lines in file. 
 39      headerLines = 0 
 40   
 41      capture = MarkerCapture() 
 42   
 43      markerIndices = dict() 
 44   
 45      while True: 
 46   
 47          # Read and count each file header line. 
 48          line = datafile.readline().strip('\r\n') 
 49          headerLines = headerLines + 1 
 50   
 51          # Key and values are tab-separated. 
 52          items = line.split('\t') 
 53          key = items[0] 
 54          values = items[1:] 
 55   
 56          # Handle relevant fields. 
 57          if key == 'FREQUENCY': 
 58              # Frame rate. 
 59              capture.frameRate = int(values[0]) 
 60              capture.framePeriod = 1/capture.frameRate 
 61          elif key == 'DATA_INCLUDED': 
 62              # 3D or 6D data. 
 63              type = values[0] 
 64              if (type == '3D'): 
 65                  # 3D data fields are implicitly XYZ co-ordinates. 
 66                  fieldNames = ['X', 'Y', 'Z'] 
 67          elif key == 'BODY_NAMES' or key == 'MARKER_NAMES': 
 68              # List of markers or 6DOF body names. 
 69              for i in range(len(values)): 
 70                  name = values[i] 
 71                  if type == '6D': 
 72                      markerClass = Marker6DOF 
 73                  else: 
 74                      markerClass = Marker3DOF 
 75                  markerIndices[markerClass(capture, name)] = i 
 76   
 77              if (type == '6D'): 
 78                  # Field names are on a line after the body names, each 
 79                  # beginning with a space. 
 80                  fieldNames = [x.strip(' ') for x in 
 81                      datafile.readline().strip('\r\n').split('\t')] 
 82                  headerLines = headerLines + 1 
 83   
 84              # The above keys are always on the last line in the header. 
 85              datafile.close() 
 86              break 
 87   
 88      # Load values from file, skipping header. 
 89      data = np.loadtxt(filename, skiprows = headerLines) 
 90      capture.frameCount = len(data) 
 91      capture.frameTimes = np.arange(0, capture.frameCount / capture.frameRate, 
 92              capture.framePeriod) 
 93   
 94      # Find index in data array for a given marker and marker field name. 
 95      def index(marker, name): 
 96          offset = markerIndices[marker] * len(fieldNames) 
 97          return offset + fieldNames.index(name) 

 98   
 99      # Return data for a given marker and marker field names. 
100      def fields(marker, names): 
101          indices = [index(marker, name) for name in names] 
102          return data[:,indices[0]:indices[-1]+1] 
103   
104      # Iterate through markers to fill in their data. 
105      for marker in capture.markers: 
106          # Get position data. 
107          positions = fields(marker, ['X', 'Y', 'Z']) / 1000 
108          if type == '6D': 
109              # Get rotation matrices. 
110              matrix_coeffs = fields(marker, ['Rot[%d]' % i for i in range(9)]) 
111              # Mark invalid data (residual = -1) with NaNs. 
112              invalid = fields(marker, ['Residual'])[:,0] == -1.0 
113              matrix_coeffs[invalid] = np.nan 
114              positions[invalid] = np.nan 
115              # Convert to quaternions and unflip. 
116              quats = QuaternionArray(np.empty((capture.frameCount,4))) 
117              for i in range(len(quats)): 
118                  q = Quaternion() 
119                  q.setFromMatrix(matrix_coeffs[i].reshape((3,3)).T) 
120                  quats[i] = q 
121              rotations = quats.unflipped() 
122              # Add rotation data to marker. 
123              for time, rotation in zip(capture.frameTimes, rotations): 
124                  marker.rotationKeyFrames.add(time, rotation) 
125          # Add position data to marker. 
126          for time, position in zip(capture.frameTimes, positions): 
127              marker.positionKeyFrames.add(time, position.reshape(3,1)) 
128   
129      return capture 
130
